page.title: 04ST LEONARDS CHURCH WILLEY
page.content: A rich{LOCAL HISTORY}is found in this church. The tower & nave are Early English in style & built of sandstone dating from the 13th century. The tower recently repointed but no longer safe for ringing the 3 bells dated 1617,1658 & 1730,has some 18th century tombstones lining the lower part. In an alcove created by the blocked north door is a 13th century ledger stone showing the relief of a robed priest hands together in prayer. During the 17th century the original roof & gallery were destroyed by fire, the gallery doorway still seen high in the north wall. The new roof is engraved 1678. A 13th century font was found in pieces in the churchyard & now stands in a corner.High on the vestry wall is a Cromwellian helmet & breastplate.The altar table,backboards & four plain benches date from Tudor times.
